decks.notes: The main concept of this Control deck is to utilize Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to control the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a focus on countering spells, removing threats, and utilizing powerful equipment such as Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte, the deck aims to maintain board control and tempo advantage. The inclusion of powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, True-Name Nemesis, and Restoration Angel further enhances the deck's ability to outmaneuver opponents. With a mix of land destruction, counterspells, and card draw, this deck is designed to outplay and outlast opponents in a one on one duel setting.

The main focus of this deck is to be aggressive and versatile, utilizing a variety of control spells to disrupt the opponent while also deploying powerful threats to quickly close out the game. With Jenara, Asura of War as the commander, the deck can quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. The deck includes a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage engines to control the game and protect its creatures. By combining disruptive elements with efficient threats like True-Name Nemesis, Sun Titan, and Stoneforge Mystic, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory in the Duel Commander format.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressively using the commander, Jenara, Asura of War, backed up by efficient and powerful creatures. The deck includes a mix of mana ramp creatures like Llanowar Elves and Noble Hierarch, alongside versatile spells like Mana Leak and Swords to Plowshares for disruption and removal. By utilizing powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte, the deck aims to quickly close out games by overwhelming the opponent with strong threats. Additionally, having a suite of counterspells and interactive cards like Vendilion Clique and Force of Will allows the deck to control the game and protect its own game plan.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary, Lotus Cobra, and Primeval Titan. It also utilizes land-based strategies with cards like Life from the Loam, Crop Rotation, and Scapeshift to generate value and put pressure on opponents. The deck includes various creatures like Avenger of Zendikar and Craterhoof Behemoth to close out games with a massive board presence. With a toolbox of cards like Worldly Tutor, Sylvan Library, and Birthing Pod, the deck is able to find answers to different situations and maintain momentum. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggro, ramp, and land synergies to secure victory in a 1 vs 1 duel.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand while setting up card advantage and powerful late-game plays. Utilizing a mix of counter spells, burn spells, board wipes, and card draw, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually accumulating resources to overwhelm them in the later turns. Keranos, God of Storms serves as a resilient win condition and card advantage engine, providing a steady stream of damage and card advantage. The deck's versatility allows it to adapt to various threats and strategies, making it a formidable opponent in a 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies and utilizing Marath, Will of the Wild as the commander to create a board presence and control the game. It includes a variety of creatures with powerful abilities such as Knight of the Reliquary, Scavenging Ooze, and Voice of Resurgence. The deck also includes key cards like Birthing Pod and Splinter Twin to generate value and create powerful combos. Additionally, there are cards like Swords to Plowshares and Lightning Bolt for removal and disruption. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of lands that provide various colors of mana and utility lands like Wasteland and Maze of Ith.

The main idea of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Selvala, Explorer Returned and various mana dorks, then use that mana to play powerful creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards like Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan to quickly close out the game, along with combo pieces like Devoted Druid and Quirion Ranger. There are also various tutor effects to find key pieces of the deck and disruption spells like Armageddon to disrupt the opponent's board. Overall, the deck aims to play aggressively, quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing Titania's ability to generate value from sacrificing lands and creating Elemental tokens. It includes a variety of mana dorks and ramp spells to quickly accelerate mana production, allowing for explosive plays. The deck also features various utility creatures and powerful spells to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with high-power creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Avenger of Zendikar. With a strong ramp package and the ability to fetch key lands, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and pressure the opponent before they can respond effectively. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Birthing Pod and Sylvan Library adds versatility and consistency to the strategy.
